title: gom-jellies
text:
here() starts at /mnt/ecocast/projects/gom-jellies


For the gom-jellies project, observations come from community scientist reports. The following species have been selected for analysis:

Cyanea capillata (Lion’s Mane)
Aurelia aurita (Moon)
Staurostoma mertensii (White Cross)
Ctenophores (Comb)


1 All Observations
Here we show the general distribution of records for the all species reported

ggplot() +
  geom_sf(data = coast, color = "black") +
  geom_sf(data = all, color = "steelblue", size = 1.5) +
  coord_sf(
    xlim = c(coast_bbox["xmin"], coast_bbox["xmax"]),
    ylim = c(coast_bbox["ymin"], coast_bbox["ymax"]),
    expand = FALSE
  ) +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(title = "All Observations") +
  theme(axis.title = element_blank())










2 Filtered Set
Here we show the general distribution of records for the 771 species listed. Later we show more detailed per-group analyses.

ggplot() +
  geom_sf(data = coast, color = "black") +
  geom_sf(data = obs, color = "steelblue", size = 1.5) +
  coord_sf(
    xlim = c(coast_bbox["xmin"], coast_bbox["xmax"]),
    ylim = c(coast_bbox["ymin"], coast_bbox["ymax"]),
    expand = FALSE
  ) +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(title = "All Observations") +
  theme(axis.title = element_blank())







ggplot(obs, aes(x = factor(year))) +
  geom_bar(fill = "steelblue") +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(
    title = "Number of Observations per Year",
    x = "Year",
    y = "Count"
  )







ggplot(obs, aes(x = factor(month))) +
  geom_bar(fill = "steelblue") +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(
    title = "Number of Observations per Month",
    x = "Month",
    y = "Count"
  )










3 By Species

ggplot() +
  geom_sf(data = coast, color = "black") +
  geom_sf(data = obs, aes(color = type), size = 1.5) +
  coord_sf(
    xlim = c(coast_bbox["xmin"], coast_bbox["xmax"]),
    ylim = c(coast_bbox["ymin"], coast_bbox["ymax"]),
    expand = FALSE
  ) +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(title = "All Observations") +
  theme(axis.title = element_blank())







ggplot(obs, aes(x = factor(year), fill = type)) +
  geom_bar() +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(
    title = "Number of Observations per Year",
    x = "Year",
    y = "Count"
  )







ggplot(obs, aes(x = factor(month), fill = type)) +
  geom_bar() +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(
    title = "Number of Observations per Month",
    x = "Month",
    y = "Count"
  )

title: White Cross Jellyfish
text:
1 Observation Distributions


Code
ggplot() +
  geom_sf(data = coast, color = "black") +
  geom_sf(data = obs, color = "red", size = 1.5) +
  coord_sf(
    xlim = c(coast_bbox["xmin"], coast_bbox["xmax"]),
    ylim = c(coast_bbox["ymin"], coast_bbox["ymax"]),
    expand = FALSE
  ) +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(title = "White Cross Jelly Observations") +
  theme(axis.title = element_blank())









Code
ggplot() +
  geom_sf(data = coast, color = "black") +
  geom_sf(data = obs, color = "red", size = 1.5, alpha = 0.7) +
  coord_sf(
    xlim = c(coast_bbox["xmin"], coast_bbox["xmax"]),
    ylim = c(coast_bbox["ymin"], coast_bbox["ymax"]),
    expand = FALSE
  ) +
  facet_wrap(~ year) +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(title = "White Cross Jelly Observations by Year") +
  theme(axis.title = element_blank())









Code
ggplot() +
  geom_sf(data = coast, color = "black") +
  geom_sf(data = obs, color = "red", size = 1.5, alpha = 0.7) +
  coord_sf(
    xlim = c(coast_bbox["xmin"], coast_bbox["xmax"]),
    ylim = c(coast_bbox["ymin"], coast_bbox["ymax"]),
    expand = FALSE
  ) +
  facet_wrap(~ month) +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(title = "White Cross Jelly Observations by Month") +
  theme(axis.title = element_blank())











2 Observation Count Histograms


Code
ggplot(obs, aes(x = factor(year))) +
  geom_bar(fill = "steelblue") +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(
    title = "White Cross Jelly Observations per Year",
    x = "Year",
    y = "Count"
  )









Code
ggplot(obs, aes(x = factor(month))) +
  geom_bar(fill = "steelblue") +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(
    title = "White Cross Jelly Observations per Month",
    x = "Month",
    y = "Count"
  )

title: Lion’s Mane Jellyfish
text:
Photo by Hans Hillewaert, licensed under CC BY-SA 4.0 via Wikimedia Commons.



Lion’s Mane Jellyfish


The lion’s mane jellyfish (Cyanea capillata) is one of the largest known species of jellyfish, named for its long, trailing tentacles that resemble a lion’s mane. It can have a bell diameter of over 2 meters (6.5 feet) and tentacles extending more than 30 meters (100 feet), though most are much smaller.


These jellyfish are typically found in the cold, northern waters of the Atlantic and Pacific Oceans, especially in the Gulf of Maine, Arctic, and North Sea. They drift with ocean currents and feed on small fish, plankton, and other jellyfish, capturing prey with stinging cells in their tentacles.


While their sting is painful, it is usually not dangerous to humans. Encounters are most common during the summer months, when they come closer to shore.


Learn more: Wikipedia – Lion’s Mane Jellyfish NOAA Ocean Service Aquarium of the Pacific



1 Observation Distributions


Code
ggplot() +
  geom_sf(data = coast, color = "black") +
  geom_sf(data = obs, color = "red", size = 1.5) +
  coord_sf(
    xlim = c(coast_bbox["xmin"], coast_bbox["xmax"]),
    ylim = c(coast_bbox["ymin"], coast_bbox["ymax"]),
    expand = FALSE
  ) +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(title = "Lion's Mane Observations") +
  theme(axis.title = element_blank())









Code
ggplot() +
  geom_sf(data = coast, color = "black") +
  geom_sf(data = obs, color = "red", size = 1.5, alpha = 0.7) +
  coord_sf(
    xlim = c(coast_bbox["xmin"], coast_bbox["xmax"]),
    ylim = c(coast_bbox["ymin"], coast_bbox["ymax"]),
    expand = FALSE
  ) +
  facet_wrap(~ year) +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(title = "Lion's Mane Observations by Year") +
  theme(axis.title = element_blank())









Code
ggplot() +
  geom_sf(data = coast, color = "black") +
  geom_sf(data = obs, color = "red", size = 1.5, alpha = 0.7) +
  coord_sf(
    xlim = c(coast_bbox["xmin"], coast_bbox["xmax"]),
    ylim = c(coast_bbox["ymin"], coast_bbox["ymax"]),
    expand = FALSE
  ) +
  facet_wrap(~ month) +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(title = "Lion's Mane Observations by Month") +
  theme(axis.title = element_blank())











2 Observation Count Histograms


Code
ggplot(obs, aes(x = factor(year))) +
  geom_bar(fill = "steelblue") +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(
    title = "Lion's Mane Observations per Year",
    x = "Year",
    y = "Count"
  )









Code
ggplot(obs, aes(x = factor(month))) +
  geom_bar(fill = "steelblue") +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(
    title = "Lion's Mane Observations per Month",
    x = "Month",
    y = "Count"
  )

title: About
text:
The jellydata project was developed at Bigelow Laboratory’s Tandy Center for Ocean Forecasting to aid in the development of modeling studies requiring either observation/abundance point data or to modeled rasterized layers for subsequent use in modeling studies. Use the github issues tracker to post questions or report issues.

credit Colby, Bigelow
blurb about Nick, Ben, Logan




 Back to top

title: Moon Jellyfish

Moon jellyfish. Photo by Zyance, licensed under CC BY-SA 2.5 via Wikimedia Commons.
